intro: Anil costaricensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican anil, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are typically opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture. Anil costaricensis is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests.
